meanings.sent1: She decided to impart the secret to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher imparted knowledge to the students in class.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to impart the gossip it overheard.
meanings.sent4: His eyes imparted a sense of wisdom beyond his years.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll imparted the history of the lost civilization.

meanings.definition: Give a share or portion of
meanings.sent1: He will impart some of his dessert with his sister.
meanings.sent2: The generous donor imparted a large sum to the charity.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to impart his magic wand with special powers.
meanings.sent4: The sun imparted warmth to the chilly morning.
meanings.sent5: The tree imparted its shade to the weary traveler.

meanings.sent1: The fairy godmother imparted kindness to the young girl.
meanings.sent2: His smile imparted a sense of joy to everyone around him.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to impart his secret recipe to the apprentice.
meanings.sent4: The old book imparted a musty smell to the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush imparted beauty to the blank canvas.
